page.title: 13THE JOURNEY TO KNOTT END.
page.content: Only walkers can cross to Knott End from Fleetwood by ferry, but Knott End is a place in which to walk. Looking back, the very short river trip makes the absence of a bridge surprising, but when one is strolling along the esplanade gazing out over broad sands and quiet waters, or walking through lanes looking over lush green dairy farmland, its absence seems welcome. The Fleetwood/Knott End ferry used to run a service boat called the Bourne May after the family that once owned Hackensall Hall;they then sold it to I.C.I.., now the main employer of the people of Fleetwood.The history of the Fleetwood/Knott End relationship is a tapestry interwoven with the names of Hesketh,Bourne May,Ashworth, Rawcliffe and Baines and it is only possible to appreciate the present state of the two areas in the light of their past.
